entry.title: Tuesday: A few showers. High 6.
entry.summary: Showers except flurries near the British Columbia border. Snow level rising to 1800 metres this afternoon. Snowfall amount 2 cm near the British Columbia border. Wind becoming southeast 20 km/h early this afternoon. High 6. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday 18 April 2023

entry.title: Tuesday night: A few flurries. Low minus 1.
entry.summary: Flurries. Local amount 2 to 4 cm. Wind southeast 20 km/h becoming west 30 gusting to 50 this evening. Low minus 1. Wind chill minus 8 overnight. Forecast issued 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday 18 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Flurries or rain showers. High plus 3.
entry.summary: Flurries changing to rain showers and flurries in the afternoon. Local snowfall amount 5 to 10 cm. Wind west 30 km/h gusting to 50. High plus 3. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday 18 April 2023
